segment.source: Best practice recommendations for Windows To Go (Windows 10)
segment.target: Best practice recommendations for Windows To Go (Windows 10)

segment.source: Best practice recommendations for Windows To Go
segment.target: Best practice recommendations for Windows To Go

segment.source: Best practice recommendations for Windows To Go
segment.target: Best practice recommendations for Windows To Go

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: The following are the best practice recommendations for using Windows To Go:
segment.target: The following are the best practice recommendations for using Windows To Go:

segment.source: Always shut down Windows and wait for shutdown to complete before removing the Windows To Go drive.
segment.target: Always shut down Windows and wait for shutdown to complete before removing the Windows To Go drive.

segment.source: Do not insert the Windows To Go drive into a running computer.
segment.target: Do not insert the Windows To Go drive into a running computer.

segment.source: Do not boot the Windows To Go drive from a USB hub.
segment.target: Do not boot the Windows To Go drive from a USB hub.

segment.source: Always insert the Windows To Go drive directly into a port on the computer.
segment.target: Always insert the Windows To Go drive directly into a port on the computer.

segment.source: If available, use a USB 3.0 port with Windows To Go.
segment.target: If available, use a USB 3.0 port with Windows To Go.

segment.source: Do not install non-Microsoft core USB drivers on Windows To Go.
segment.target: Do not install non-Microsoft core USB drivers on Windows To Go.

segment.source: Suspend BitLocker on Windows host computers before changing the BIOS settings to boot from USB and then resume BitLocker protection.
segment.target: Suspend BitLocker on Windows host computers before changing the BIOS settings to boot from USB and then resume BitLocker protection.

segment.source: Additionally, we recommend that when you plan your deployment you should also plan a standard operating procedure for answering questions about which USB drives can be used for Windows To Go and how to enable booting from USB to assist your IT department or help desk in supporting users and work groups that want to use Windows To Go.
segment.target: Additionally, we recommend that when you plan your deployment you should also plan a standard operating procedure for answering questions about which USB drives can be used for Windows To Go and how to enable booting from USB to assist your IT department or help desk in supporting users and work groups that want to use Windows To Go.

segment.source: It may be very helpful for your organization to work with your hardware vendors to create an IT standard for USB drives for use with Windows To Go, so that if groups within your organization want to purchase drives they can quickly determine which ones they should obtain.
segment.target: It may be very helpful for your organization to work with your hardware vendors to create an IT standard for USB drives for use with Windows To Go, so that if groups within your organization want to purchase drives they can quickly determine which ones they should obtain.
